content: Nate Diaz's professional mixed martial arts career began with a bare knuckle fight against Robert Limon in 2002, when he was just 17 years old. After this, he mainly competed in the World Extreme Cagefighting (WEC) organization. In 2006, Diaz fought for the WEC Lightweight Championship against Hermes França at WEC 24, but ultimately lost by submission in the second round. This was the final event held by the WEC before it was purchased by the UFC's parent company, Zuffa, LLC.
